alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Gloucester, Middlesex, King and Queen, Northumberland, Richmond, northwestern York, New Kent, southeastern Westmoreland, southeastern King William, northern James City, southeastern Essex and Lancaster Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over Jamaica, or 9 miles northeast of King And Queen Court House, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Kent, West Point, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Montross, Fair Port, Norge, Robley, King And Queen Court House, Toano, Callao, Lancaster, White Stone, Kinsale, Providence Forge, Saluda, Farnham and Jamaica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland; York
